required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of an Investigational Regimen Combining FDA Approved HIV Drugs in HIV-Infected Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 24-week study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a once-daily ritonavir-boosted fosamprenavir regimen (1400mg/100mg QD) to a 200mg ritonavir-boosted fosamprenavir regimen administered either twice-daily or once-daily.

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase IIIB, randomized, open-label, parallel group, multi-center, non-inferiority, 24-week study to evaluate the safety, efficacy and tolerability of switching from a 200mg ritonavir-boosted regimen of LEXIVA (700mg/100mg BID or 1400mg/200mg QD) to a once-daily, 100mg ritonavir-boosted regimen of LEXIVA (1400mg/100mg QD)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Not Meeting the Definition of Virologic Failure at or Prior to Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Virologic failure was defined as two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA measures greater than 400 copies/milliliter (mL) separated by at least 2 to 4 week. The percentage of participants not meeting the virologic failure definition was estimated with stratification by the six randomization strata using Mantel-Haenszel weights and the missing/discontinuation equals failure (MD=F) analysis. Missing/discontinuation values were considered failures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Plasma Human Immunodeficiency Virus, Type 1, Ribonucleic Acid (HIV-1 RNA) <400 Copies/mL at Week 24, Time to Loss of Virologic Response (TLOVR) Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn to determine the amount of plasma HIV-1 RNA virus in copies/mL at week 24. The percentage of participants with plasma HIV-1 RNA <400 copies/mL at Week 24 were determined by the TLOVR algorithm with stratification by the six randomization strata.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL at Week 24, TLOVR Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn to determine the amount of plasma HIV-1 RNA virus in copies/mL at week 24. The percentage of participants plasma with HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL at Week 24 were determined by the TLOVR algorithm with stratification by the six randomization strata.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline of log10 Copies/mL Plasma HIV-1 RNA Levels at Week 24, Observed Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn to determine the amount of plasma HIV-1 RNA virus in copies/mL at week 24. Change from baseline was defined as plasma HIV-1 RNA level at Week 24 minus plasma HIV-1 RNA level at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Change From Baseline of CD4+ Cell Count at Week 24, Observed Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn to determine the CD4+ cell count at week 24. Change from baseline was defined as CD4+ cell count at Week 24 minus CD4+ cell count at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Discontinued Treatment Due to Adverse Events Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who prematurely discontinued study drug due to adverse events was tabulated. Data are summarized by individual adverse event. Adverse events were defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 2-4 Adverse Events Occurring in Greater Than or Equal to 2% of Subjects Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced any grades 2 to 4 adverse events was tabulated. Adverse events were graded based on the Division of Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS) Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol, High Density Lipoprotein (HDL), and Triglycerides at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn to determine the cholesterol, HDL, triglycerides levels at Week 24. Percent change in total blood cholesterol, HDL, and triglycerides was defined as (lipid level at Week 24 minus level at baseline) divided by level at baseline x 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn to determine the LDL level at Week 24. Percent change in LDL was defined as (LDL level at Week 24 minus level at baseline) divided by level at baseline x 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA Genotypic Mutations and Phenotypic Resistance at Time of Virologic Failure Not Present at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: A blood sample was drawn for subjects failing to respond to therapy and the mutations present in the virus were identified. For each subject, the mutations found at the time of failure were compared with any mutations found in the blood sample at baseline. New mutations that developed at the time of virologic failure were tabulated by drug class.

secondary_outcome.measure: Steady-State Plasma Levels of Amprenavir (APV) and Ritonavir (RTV) Ctau at Weeks 12 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn at weeks 12 and 24 to determine the plasma levels of APV and RTV. Concentration at the end of the dosing interval at steady state (Ctau) was presented.

intervention.description: Once daily, reduced dose ritonavir-boosted fosamprenavir

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Subjects with HIV-1 infection.
- Are willing and able to understand and provide written consent prior to participation in this study.
Exclusion criteria:
- Are pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Have an active AIDS condition, pancreatitis, poor kidney function, or clinically relevant hepatitis.
- Have certain medical conditions that may make participation unsafe.
- Take medication that may interact with the study medication.
- Have a history of allergy to any of the study drugs or any excipients therein.
- Other inclusion/exclusion criteria to be evaluated by the physician.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were stratified prior to randomization according to baseline regimen (700 milligrams [mg]/100 mg twice a day [BID] or 1400 mg/200 mg once a day [QD]) and previous regimen (no other prior protease inhibitor [PI], non-boosted PI, or boosted PI). Results are reported for the 209 participants (out of 211 enrolled) receiving study drug.

group.title: FPV/r100
group.description: Fosamprenavir (FPV)/ritonavir (RTV) 1400mg/100mg once a day (QD)

group.title: FPV/r200
group.description: FPV/RTV (either 700mg/100mg twice a day [BID] or 1400mg/200mg QD)

group.description: Fosamprenavir (FPV)/ritonavir (RTV) 1400mg/100mg once a day (QD)

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Not Meeting the Definition of Virologic Failure at or Prior to Week 24
outcome.description: Virologic failure was defined as two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA measures greater than 400 copies/milliliter (mL) separated by at least 2 to 4 week. The percentage of participants not meeting the virologic failure definition was estimated with stratification by the six randomization strata using Mantel-Haenszel weights and the missing/discontinuation equals failure (MD=F) analysis. Missing/discontinuation values were considered failures.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Exposed (ITT-E) Population. Subjects who received at least one dose of investigational product.

group.title: FPV/r100
group.description: Fosamprenavir (FPV)/ritonavir (RTV) 1400mg/100mg once a day (QD)

group.title: FPV/r200
group.description: FPV/RTV (either 700mg/100mg twice a day [BID] or 1400mg/200mg QD)

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Not Meeting the Definition of Virologic Failure at or Prior to Week 24
measure.description: Virologic failure was defined as two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA measures greater than 400 copies/milliliter (mL) separated by at least 2 to 4 week. The percentage of participants not meeting the virologic failure definition was estimated with stratification by the six randomization strata using Mantel-Haenszel weights and the missing/discontinuation equals failure (MD=F) analysis. Missing/discontinuation values were considered failures.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Exposed (ITT-E) Population. Subjects who received at least one dose of investigational product.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority of FPV/r100 to FPV/r200 would be declared if the lower limit of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval on the difference in percentage of participants not meeting the virologic failure definition [FPV/r100 minus FPV/r200] was -12% or greater.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in percentages = percentage in Arm 1 minus percentage in Arm 2

Adverse events were defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.
outcome.population: Safety Population: all randomized subjects who consumed at least one dose of study drug and was analyzed according to the treatment received.

outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn at weeks 12 and 24 to determine the plasma levels of APV and RTV. Concentration at the end of the dosing interval at steady state (Ctau) was presented.
outcome.population: PK Parameter (Ctau) Population - Participants in the ITT-E Population who underwent PK sampling and had evaluable APV or RTV Ctau data.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
